item.title: EA Sports FC adding first paid battle pass
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/ea-sports-fc-adding-first-paid-battle-pass

"To give you more options when choosing what content you want to pursue."

EA Sports FC 25 is introducing its first paid battle pass, after previously experimenting with a free version of the feature.

Timed ahead of the game's Team of the Season (TOTS) event, EA will roll out a premium version of the Season 7 pass priced at 500k in-game UT Coins, or which you can buy for 1000 FC Points (around Â£9).

Access to this 40-tier pass begins today, 24th April, and will reward tradeable packs, Season Point boosters, TOTS items, evolution consumables and retro cosmetic evolutions. Its centrepiece is an exclusive 96-rated Immortal Icon Franck Ribery, the former French winger who spent most of his career at Bayern Munich.

Announcing the Premium Pass, EA said that while this iteration of the battle pass wouldn't change, it would be "monitoring your feedback to make sure we deliver the best experience possible in whatever mode you play in FC moving forward".

Anyone with feedback is invited to provide it via the EA Sports Discord, or EA's own direct feedback portal.

On social media, however, the opinions are somewhat mixed. While some players have pointed to the items within the pass making up for its costs - and Ribery alone being worth the coins - others have said that Ultimate Team is already a money-sucking experience, without another additional thing to buy.

"Having Players EXCLUSIVE to the Paid Season pass is extremely greedy and is not the path to go down," wrote social media user Wildcat. "If its packs/cosmetics/SP/kits im sure 99 percent of the community won't mind. But locking a card like that ribery behind a paywall??? Even if its only 500k coins its just greedy as hell."

"Don't get the outrage," wrote Norwich City supporter Callum, however. "I ain't sticking up for EA but if that Ribery was an SBC everyone would be happy spending 500k on it ðŸ˜‚ Let alone the other rewards (you even get coins back from tradable packs)."

EA Sports recently said that its upcoming Switch 2 versions of FC and Madden NFL would aim to have feature parity with other consoles "as much as the hardware allows".

"This is a new FC, with some genuine differences on- and off-pitch," our Chris Tapsell wrote in Eurogamer's EA Sports FC 25 review. "It's also the exact same FC it's always been."

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Edition upgrade prices for Kirby and Mario Party cost more than Zelda
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/nintendo-switch-2-edition-upgrade-prices-for-kirby-and-mario-party-cost-more-than-zelda

We now know how much those previously announced Nintendo Switch 2 Edition upgrades for games like The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild will cost. However, I am afraid it is not going to be a 'one size fits all' deal.

As shown on Nintendo's official store, The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild â€“ Nintendo Switch 2 Edition will cost Â£66.99 on its release, but those who already own the game on the original Switch can upgrade their copy for Â£7.99. This is the same for its sequel, Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom.

However, while Kirby and the Forgotten Land - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Star-Crossed World also retails for Â£66.99 via Nintendo, its upgrade back is Â£16.99. So, Â£9 more than Breath of the Wild's upgrade pack.

This is the same pricing as Super Mario Party Jamboree â€“ Nintendo Switch 2 Edition ï¼‹ Jamboree TV. As with Kirby, the Switch 2 edition of Super Mario Party Jamboree retails for Â£66.99, with an upgrade pack available for owners of the original game coming in at Â£16.99.

It is worth noting that while the Zelda games do both have new features arriving with their Switch 2 editions, such as Zelda Notes, Kirby does have new content coming, which takes the form of a remixed campaign known as Star-Crossed World. But then the Zelda upgrades come as part of a Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack subscription, while others do not.

Switch 2 pre-orders went live in the US earlier today, having been delayed due to concerns about tariffs. However, things have been rather chaotic for those across the pond, with retailers selling out of stock and orders reportedly getting cancelled.

Nintendo has already acknowledged unexpectedly high demand in Japan, casting doubt on consistent Switch 2 stock levels worldwide ahead of its 5th June release.

item.title: Over 20 games leaving PS Plus Extra, Premium next month
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/over-20-games-leaving-ps-plus-extra-premium-next-month

Batman: Arkham Knight! GTA 5! More!

A quick heads up for PlayStation Plus subscribers. Sony has updated its PS Plus Last Chance to Play section, revealing more than 20 games which will be leaving the service next month.

As of 24th April, these games are:

  • GTA 5
  • MotoGP 24
  • The Sims 4: Island Living expansion pack
  • Resistance: Fall of Man
  • Resistance 2
  • Walkabout Mini Golf
  • Synth Riders
  • Ghostbusters: Rise of the Ghost Lord
  • Before Your Eyes
  • The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners
  • The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners â€“ Chapter 2: Retribution â€“ Payback Edition
  • Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2
  • Stranded: Alien Dawn
  • The Lego Movie 2 Video game
  • Ghostrunner
  • Payday 2: Crimewave Edition
  • Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night
  • Journey To The Savage Planet: Employee Of The Month
  • Portal Knights
  • Enter the Gungeon
  • Batman: Arkham Knight
  • Infamous: Second Son

The above titles will be removed from PS Plus in the coming weeks.

Personally, I have quite a soft spot for the Sims 4 Island Living pack. This is the one set on Sulani, and it gives Sims 4 players the chance to live out their tropical beachy dreams. Please hand me a cocktail with an umbrella in it right now. Cheers!

Another personal favourite of mine from this batch of leavers is Batman: Arkham Knight. "A confident mixture of familiar gameplay and bold storytelling brings Rocksteady's superhero trilogy to a satisfying, memorable close," reads Eurogamer's Batman: Arkham Knight review from 2015 (has it really been that long?!).

Ghostrunner, meanwhile, is a fast-paced cyberpunk action game our Bertie called a "constant joy to play".

"Ghostrunner is a game about the joy of movement, and I love how it never loses sight of that," he wrote in Eurogamer's Ghostrunner review.

As of this month, PlayStation Plus members across all subscription tiers are able to get their hands on the following three titles:

  • RoboCop: Rogue City | PS5
  • The Texas Chain Saw Massacre | PS4, PS5
  • Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth â€“ Hacker's Memory | PS4

You can find more details on what else is on offer thanks to our full PlayStation Plus guide here.

item.title: Frostpunk 1886 is a revamped version of the original game with new content, due 2027
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/frostpunk-1886-is-a-revamped-version-of-the-original-game-with-new-content-due-2027

Developer 11 bit Studios has officially unveiled its new Frostpunk game.

It's called Frostpunk 1886, and is a revamped version of the original Frostpunk using Unreal Engine 5. However, 11 bit has said this release won't simply be a visual overhaul of the original. Rather, Frostpunk 1886 will include new content for players to discover, as well as new mechanics, laws, and an entirely new Purpose path.

The upcoming release - which is scheduled for 2027 - will also bring mod support with it, with the developer stating reimagining Frostpink in Unreal Engine "allows the game to become a living, expandable platform". That also means, future DLC is indeed a possibility.

All of this, 11 bit says, will offer up a "fresh" gameplay experience for even the "most seasoned" of Frostpunk-ers.

"The title marks the start of a new era for 11 bit studios - one focused on delivering in-house projects more frequently than ever before," the Frostpunk 1886 team said, promising more details in the coming months. Stay tuned!

You can check out the announcement trailer for Frostpunk 1886 below.

We first got word of Frostpunk 1886 earlier this month, though we didn't know its name then. Speaking with our Bertie, 11 bit CEO PrzemysÅ‚aw MarszaÅ‚ teased the upcoming title, stating: "We totally believe in Frostpunk. We believe in that IP. We totally believe in that fantasy."

For more on the studio, you can find out about 11 bit's cancelled game - known as Project 8 - here.
